skill.name: research-agent-optimization
skill.description: Optimize the research agent for rate limit handling, API call efficiency, web search integration fixes, and improved streaming UX with granular progress updates and source attribution.
skill.summary: Optimize the research agent for rate limit handling, API call efficiency, web search integration fix...
skill.author: BenderFendor

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure YAML specification document containing no executable code. It describes optimization tasks for a research agent but poses no security risk to users.

content.user_title: Optimize research agent performance and UX
content.value_statement: Research agents often hit API rate limits and show unclear progress, frustrating users. This skill adds exponential backoff, proper web search integration, and real-time progress updates so users stay informed during long research tasks.
actual_capabilities: Implements exponential backoff retry logic for API calls (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s maximum)
Fixes DuckDuckGo web search tool initialization with proper DDGS import
Adds granular streaming events showing exact tool execution (web_search, news_search, internal_search)
Caches semantic search results for 5 minutes to avoid duplicate API calls
Provides user-friendly error messages for rate limits, timeouts, and tool failures
Renders source cards with titles, dates, and thumbnails instead of raw JSON blocks
limitations: Does not modify external API services - only handles responses gracefully
Cannot increase actual API quotas imposed by Google Gemini or DuckDuckGo
Requires existing backend and frontend files to be present at specified paths

use_cases.title: Track research progress
use_cases.description: See real-time updates as the agent searches web, news, and internal databases

use_cases.title: Fix API integration bugs
use_cases.description: Resolve DuckDuckGo tool naming issues and implement proper error handling

use_cases.title: Get reliable source attribution
use_cases.description: Receive clean answers with clickable source cards instead of confusing JSON

prompt_templates.title: Fix web search
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the DuckDuckGo web search tool initialization in the research agent. The import should use 'from duckduckgo_search import DDGS'. Ensure web_search and news_search tools are properly bound to the LLM with fallback to internal search.

prompt_templates.title: Add rate limiting
prompt_templates.prompt: Add exponential backoff retry logic to Gemini API calls with 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s delays. Implement 429 error detection with user-friendly messages like 'API Rate Limit: please wait a moment and try again.'

prompt_templates.title: Improve streaming clarity
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the research streaming generator to emit granular SSE events. Each event should include tool name, query parameters, timestamps, and execution duration. Map web_search('query') to 'Searching web for: query...' style messages.

prompt_templates.title: Render sources properly
prompt_templates.prompt: Update frontend to remove JSON blocks from research answers. Add a 'Sources' section with clickable article cards showing title, source, date, and thumbnail. Group sources by retrieval method.

best_practices: Add cache with TTL to prevent duplicate API calls within short time windows
Provide user-friendly error messages instead of showing raw stack traces
Log API quota usage and remaining tokens for debugging and monitoring
anti_patterns: Showing raw JSON blocks in user-facing responses without formatting
Using hardcoded model names without configuration options
Failing silently when web search tools encounter errors

faq.question: Which AI models are supported for rate limit handling?
faq.answer: This skill implements rate limit handling for Gemini API calls. The recommended model is gemini-2.0-flash for faster response and lower token cost.

faq.question: What retry delays are used for exponential backoff?
faq.answer: The implementation uses 1 second, 2 seconds, 4 seconds, and 8 second maximum delays between retry attempts for 429 errors.

faq.question: How does the web search fallback work?
faq.answer: If DuckDuckGo web search fails, the agent falls back to internal news search. This ensures research continues even with external API issues.

faq.question: Is any user data sent to external APIs?
faq.answer: Search queries are sent to DuckDuckGo for web and news searches. No personal user data is collected or transmitted beyond normal search queries.

faq.question: Why do I still see rate limit errors sometimes?
faq.answer: This skill improves handling but cannot increase actual API quotas. Gemini and DuckDuckGo impose limits that cannot be bypassed. The skill makes these errors user-friendly.

faq.question: How is this different from standard Claude research capabilities?
faq.answer: This skill adds specific optimizations for a custom news research application including caching, streaming clarity, and source card rendering that standard capabilities do not provide.
